## HDOMOpts.hydrate property

If true, the first frame will only be used to inject event listeners, using the `hydrateDOM()` function.

\*Important:\* Enabling this option assumes that an equivalent DOM (minus event listeners) already exists (e.g. generated via SSR / hiccup's `serialize()`<!-- -->) when hdom's `start()` function is called. Any other discrepancies between the pre-existing DOM and the hdom trees will cause undefined behavior.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
hydrate?: boolean;
```
